summary: The concept of "industrial electric machinery" is classified under the category of electronics and electrical engineering within EU regulatory frameworks. This subdivision encompasses goods that are wholly or partly involved in the generation, distribution, and utilization of electrical energy. The nomenclature for these products is indicated in the customs tariff, which provides a binding classification for trade purposes. Authorities may invoke specific rules and interpretations when applying this classification, ensuring uniformity in the treatment of these goods. Additional information regarding the functioning of this sector is annexed in implementing regulations, which are issued periodically to adapt to evolving market conditions.
